div.a: Adapted from Inventory of Greek Coin Hoards

div.pre: 154 Crete, central region, 1936 (62, 283) Burial: - B.C. (Le Rider) ; after 270 (Hackens) Contents: 127+ AR Boeotia: 1 dr. Corinth and colonies: 14 st. Argos: 27 tetrob. Pseudaeginetica: 1 triob. Axus?: 1 st. Chersonesus: 2 st. Cnossus: 14 st.; 5 dr. Cydonia: 3 st. Eleutherna: 1 ob. Elyrus: 1 dr. Gortyna: 6 st.; 2 dr.; 1 triob. Itanus: 2 st.; 3 dr. Lyttus: 4 st. Moda: 1 st. Phaestus: 5 st. Phalasarna: 2 st. Praesus: 4 st.; 1 dr. Rhaucus: 3 st. Sybrita: 7 st. Tylisus: 4 st. Cyrene: 12 didr. Disposition: Athens 55 (all non-Cretan and Pseudaeg. triob.); London 10 (Cretan issues identified by Le Rider) † Le Rider, Monn. crét., pp. 11-9 and pp. 40-9 (for date) Hackens, Antidorum W. Peremans, p. 42, note 1 (for date) The figures for the Cretan coins are min- imal. Varoucha (BCH 1960, pp. 490-1), reporting 700 (?) coins in the original hd., gives varieties but not the number of each. Six didrachms of Cyrene (Her- mes Parammon) acquired by Athens before 1940 and simply labelled "Hoard" probably come from this hd. nad should be added to the Athens total See also no. 318 below
